I have worked in the exact same amazon warehouse three years ago. I was a packer, it was my first job when I arrived in England. The pay was almost minimum wage and the work conditions were OK! I had a target for packing items per hour, and sometimes I was reaching the target and sometimes I wasn't. No one gave a shit if I was reaching the target or not, however, the team leader would tell you that "you can do better". Most of the times there were incentives for people who packs the most products per hour - free lunch and cash money. The environment was really friendly, I actually made few friends and we were talking and laughing while we were working. Even the team leader would come now and then and ask you if you're OK, if you need anything, if she could help you with anything. The warehouse was perfectly clean all the time and even though everyone had targets to accomplish, no one seemed in a rush. I absolutely loved working there but I moved on after three months. I don't know how you people do it. I wouldn't have the patience to text someone for YEARS before meeting. The longest I've texted someone before meeting up was about two hours, split into two nights. The way I look at it, I'm not a therapist and definitely not on dating sites to be someone's emotional pillow. Dating is about chemistry. Once it's obvious that there is interest from both sides, we either move to the next step together, either I move to the next one. Texting for a little while is to be expected, so we can asses the other person mental capacity and get a whif of their personality. Everything else can be done on a first date. Most people just want someone to give them attention, boost their ego, make them feel good about themselves. Those are time waisters and not worth entertaining. Falling in love over text messages it's actually not healthy. You love the image of someone you've created in your mind and most of the times it turns out to be deceiving. "Awww, he likes Netflix too. I can't believe we have so many things in common " she says. Well, guess what? Everyone who knows and has access to Netflix, likes Netflix. Don't get fooled into the texting game and try and meet the other person as fast as possible. It could be a waste of time, even years by the looks of it. Remember - In text messages, people tend to create a image of themselves based on how they want you to perceive them.

I'm very familiar with this drug. Scopolamine, also known as "devil's breath" or "burundanga". It's made from the extracts of plants in the nightshade family such as henbane and jimson weed. It's a deliriant, meaning it can induce symptoms of delirium such as disorientation, loss of memory, hallucinations, and stupor. It is indeed used as a rape drug. Most often, the rapist will blow it into the victims face as its a white powder. They also can put them on Maps and stop someone (victim) and ask for directions and when the victim will get closer to the map to have a look, they will sniff the drug without knowing. It is used in different ways and it's very effective. Most common reactions include disorientation (loss of common sense and control) and loss of memory. The abuser can make you cash out money from your card and you won't remember a thing after that. Also they can rape you and you won't know what happened when you wake up as you have no memory. If given a large quantity, it can and will cause death. It will also cause death if you suffer from different medical conditions which might make the effort of Scopolamine fatal. It's also very hard if not impossible to trace it into the body / blood after 24 hours or even less (depending on the quantity ingested and other biological factors). Your friend (?) most definitely sniffed Scopolamine while someone was near her ears. Scopolamine won't have any effect if blown into the ears, but because the powder light constitution, it's very easy to be sniffed from the air. It is also an highly illegal and very dangerous drug. Source: I've been part of an anti drugs team few years ago.

The wording should sound relatively smart and have good grammar. Pictures matter a lot more than description, unfortunately. Especially on Tinder, it's the first thing which will get her attention and make her look deeper into your profile. Solo pictures are more than fine, but they shouldn't be all the same. Try and put some pictures doing different things / activities. Get a friend and go out and take some pictures doing stuff. Would be really helpful if it looks like you're having fun, smiling or laughing and make sure you don't wear the same clothes in every picture. Finally, when you match with someone, you should start chatting. Don't wait for her to make the first move, just go for it. I usually say something like "Hey [name], how's your day going?". Have a bit of chit chat and then ask her for her number, or a date. You don't want to waste your time chatting with strangers, you want to go on a date. If she's up for it, great. If not, then there are others waiting to match with you and go on a date. I try and meetup as soon as I know I'll have the time to go on a date. It could be tommorow or this weekend. I let her find excuses once or twice as I understand that people are busy and their life doesn't revolve around me. If she says something like "I can't tomorrow but will date Saturday ", I know that she wants to but it's just a matter of time. Once I get her number, we chat on WhatsApp. I never ever call before dating but I guess it's a personal preference. Hope it helps.

About 8 years ago I used to live in a flat with my then girlfriend. After a 14 hrs shift, I returned "home". I got in as the door was unlocked, left my shoes at the entrance and went in the living room. The lights were off but the TV was already on so I just took a sit on the sofa, put my feet on the coffee table and I was waiting for my then girlfriend to come out from the bedroom and greet me at some point. About 10 minutes later, an 80 years old lady comes out from the bedroom in a dressing gawn. I froze. It was midnight, I was at home where it was supposed to be just me and my girlfriend. But all I could see was an 80 years old lady in a dressing gawn. I was sure I didn't knew her. I was sure she wasn't there to rob us at that age, but I couldn't understand what was she doing in our flat in a dressing gawn at midnight wandering around. She seemed to be as shocked as I was. We just stood there for a while looking at each other, waiting for each other to make a move. Those few seconds or perhaps minutes, felt like an eternity. Meanwhile, my girlfriend was calling me wondering why I'm not home yet. And this is how I met my neighbour from the flat below mine.

What do you think his boss is going to do? The boss will start collecting empty bottles and cans to make some money? I'd I'd be his boss, I would be glad that he is taking the empty bottles / cups / cans away to be fair. The recycling bin can get full very fast which might be unconvient, which might cost him even more to get it emptied several times. There won't be any random empty bottles laying around the shop / bar which might display a bad image. As a boss, you're supposed to encourage and support your employees all the times. The boss is already making profit from selling the drinks. No one cares about the empty bottle. If the boss would care about the empty bottle, he wouldn't be able to afford having employees. I think you might save some money and perhaps you'll get your car home at some point. The main problem here is that your business model is not very much time or money efficient. If you collect hundreds of empty bottles, that is a big volume of material. How are you going to transport all that to the recycling center? You need to calculate your fuel if you do several trips and also need to take into account how much time you're spending with all this. Collecting. Storing. Packing. Transporting. Unloading. Even if it sounds like a small job, you do need a small business plan to see if you're actually making any profit out of it and if you do, you need to ask yourself if it's worth doing all tag work for that profit. You might come to the realisation that you could make the same money just by working an extra hour or two a week at your job. Or perhaps, maybe it's worth looking for a part time job along with your full time one? Nothing is impossible, just always make sure that whatever you do, it's worth it.

I woke up in the morning and told my parents everything in detail what I've dreamed about. They said it was just a nightmare and that everything is fine, even if I kept telling them that everything seemed so real. I came back from school and it was almost 3 pm. My mother was cooking exactly what I've dreamed that she will cook. She was wearing exactly what I've dreamed that she will wear and she was even in a position as I've dreamed that she would be. There it is, 3 pm and someone knocks on our door. I tell my mother without even looking who is at the door and what are they going to tell her. She shouts at me and says to stop worrying about my dream. She opens the door and sees exactly the people I was telling her about and they had a sad face. They've started to tell her the bad news. I was like "I can't believe this is happening right now".

WRITING.TITLE: Had mine done Friday 15th. Here's my experience.
WRITING.TEXT: I went for a non scalpel vasectomy to a private clinic. The procedure took 15 minutes and then I had to stay there for 20 minutes to see if I'm OK. They took my blood pressure and it was fine. We went through what I need to do for the next few days (painkillers, ice, no lifting) and then they took my blood pressure again and it was 76. Everyone went into panic mode while I was feeling kind of light headed. They gave me a glucose tablet and two minutes later I was good to leave. The procedure itself was somehow painful. I felt the needle for 1 second but that was nothing. No pain. Then, about 3 minutes later the Dr said that he needs to pull my tube a bit and I might feel some discomfort. That was really painful as I've literally felt my sperm tube being pulled through my lower abs. It only took 10 seconds or so but it was painful. Then, on the second incision, he had to pull the tube again from the other side and felt as bad as the right side. Except those 2 X 10 separate seconds, I haven't felt anything else. About 10 minutes after everything was all done, I've started to get big pain in my lower ab / hip which lasted for one hour (that was really painful). The Dr said it's normal and that it's my tube retracting (or trying to). After an hour, I assume the painkillers kicked in and I was pain free for the rest of the time. Now it's not painful, but it is "there". It's like a dull sensation. I'm on paracetamol and ipubrofen and wearing a jockstrap at all times. Haven't put any ice yet but I'm tempted to try and see if it's any different. My penis and balls are so bruised and it seems that as time goes on, it gets even more bruised. Am I happy that I've done it? Absolutely. Would I do it again? Not sure. I hope there won't be scaring marks. Hopefully I'll be on my 100% soon.

I was thinking that maybe this is a mistake and maybe I'm just going through a rough mental period and maybe I shouldn't do it. While thinking this, a family with 3 little children came in for the husband to have a vasectomy. They sat next to me in the waiting room. The children started to run around, scream, laugh, jump, etc. It's only been 2 minutes since they came in but I was already mentally exhausted. That was the moment I knew I'm doing the right choice. It's only been a few days but I would do it again if I'd have a choice. Hope it helps and good luck.

I work minimum 300 hours / month (380 hours was the most I've worked in a month after a break up). - I go to the gym 3 times a week (2-3 hours each time). - I take piano and violin lessons and I'm about to start taking tango lessons. - I spend a lot of time reading things I enjoy and also writing stuff on Quora and other forums. - I fly abroad for a weekend every 2-3 months for a short holiday (different countries in Europe). - I'm studying for a management diploma online from ILM and other few things. - I always keep in touch with people I care about, visiting or calling them regularly. - I'm a serial dater. I try and go on a different date every weekend. Sometimes I'm bored and have nothing to do, so I'm either learning a new language, or I have a few hours of sleep in the day time. So far I speak 4 languages + BSL and Braille. I've started to learn English 5 years ago. It's all about planning your time in advance and setting priorities. I wake up every day at 7:30 AM, despite if I'm working or not, if I've slept for an hour or ten. I make the most of my time. I have no children, no girlfriend. I don't like alcohol so I'm always at my 100% because there is no hangover. I don't need to worry about cleaning as I keep everything clean. I put my clothes to wash while I'm having dinner and I put them to dry after I finished my dinner. I fold them and put them away next morning as part of my "making coffee" routine. Sometimes I'm tempted to take a part time job as well, this is why I have qualified as a: - masseur - CNC operator - forklift driver - trainer / teacher - recruitment consultant. I'm currently studying for some more qualifications in different fields. I'll probably never going to take a part time job, but the idea of knowing how to do / being qualified in different things, turns me on.
